title: Samosa
instruction:
1. Prepare the dough by mixing flour, oil, and water.
2. Make the filling by cooking boiled potatoes with spices.
3. Roll out the dough and cut it into triangular shapes.
4. Add the filling and fold the dough into a cone shape.
5. Deep fry until golden brown.
6. Serve hot with chutney.

title: Vada Pav
instruction:
1. Prepare the potato filling with mashed potatoes and spices.
2. Shape the filling into small balls and coat with besan batter.
3. Deep fry the potato balls until crispy.
4. Toast the pav buns lightly with butter.
5. Assemble the Vada Pav with chutneys and the fried vada.
6. Serve immediately.

title: Burger
instruction:
1. Prepare the patty using minced meat or vegetables, breadcrumbs, and spices.
2. Cook the patty on a grill or frying pan until done.
3. Toast the burger buns lightly.
4. Assemble the burger with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and sauce.
5. Place the cooked patty and close with the top bun.
6. Serve with fries.

title: Gulab Jamun
instruction:
1. Prepare the dough using khoya, flour, and milk.
2. Shape the dough into small balls.
3. Deep fry the balls until golden brown.
4. Prepare sugar syrup with water, sugar, and cardamom.
5. Soak the fried balls in the sugar syrup for 1-2 hours.
6. Serve warm or chilled.

title: Pani Puri
instruction:
1. Prepare the puris: Mix semolina, flour, and water to form a stiff dough. Roll out thin puris and deep fry until they puff up and become crispy.
2. Make the spicy water: Blend fresh mint leaves, coriander, green chilies, and tamarind pulp with water. Add spices such as cumin powder, chaat masala, and black salt for flavor. Chill the water in the refrigerator.
3. Prepare the filling: Boil and mash potatoes. Add boiled chickpeas and season with salt, chaat masala, and lemon juice.
4. Assemble: Carefully crack open the top of each puri to create a small hole. Fill with the potato and chickpea mixture.
5. Add tamarind chutney or sweet chutney on top of the filling.
6. Dip the filled puris into the chilled spicy water and serve immediately for the best taste.
